Showing Interest in your Client
Notes: How to appear enthusiastic and knowledgable about the things your client cares about so that the client feels more confident in delegating tasks related to professional and personal goals

Name: Communicating Availability
Notes: Ensuring EAs let clients know when they sign off or when to expect their return so the client has confidence and predictability for responses and when action will be taken

Name: Communicating What You're Working On
Notes: Practices for sending client's daily updates on what's being prioritized or done along with any blockers so they feel confident on what's happening

Name: Improving Responsiveness
Notes: How to properly acknowledge tasks and get any missing information early so your client feels strongly that the task will be handled quickly and successfully. Also setting expectations for how the EA confirms. e.g. "Noted" is fine and not too short/abrupt so long as you set expectations.

Name: Documenting Processes
Notes: How to document or create quick SOPs that leave the client confident that the EA is completing tasks in a reliable way

Name: Encouraging your Client to Delegate
Notes: Perhaps just a checklist that puts more pressure on EAs to ask their client to delegate more. We can provide prompts or templates for this by approaching it categorically

Name: Travel Documents
Notes: Putting together a document for your client when they travel.
